fields.headline: Quick getaways for Easter
fields.bodyText: Under £200 Cologne's famous Chocolate Factory is a state of the art temple to the art of chocolate making, boasting a flowing chocolate fountain, live production factory and numerous other attractions for chocaholics. The German Travel Centre (020 8429 2900) can organise a two night break over Easter staying at the luxurious four star Maritim Hotel for just £195. This is on a room only basis but also includes scheduled flights from Heathrow with either BA or Lufthansa. Under £300 The evening of Saturday 23 March sees the spectacular Caribbean Carnival in Antwerp kicking up a salsa storm in the Sportpaleis in this attractive Belgian city. Spend the nights of 22 and 23 at the five star Antwerp Hilton on one of the main squares for £225. This includes breakfasts and Eurostar travel from Waterloo. Call ShortBreaks (020 8402 0007). Carnival tickets cost 25 euros and can be obtained via the internet on www.antilliaansefeesten.be. Save £89 with Travelscene (020 8424 9648) on a weekend trip before 20 March to Stockholm. With return BA flights from Heathrow and two nights B&B accommodation at the two star Lilla Radmannen Hotel in the city centre the cost is now £235. Eurotours is offering three nights in Paris, from 29 March, at the recently renovated three-star Hotel Europe, close to the Eiffel Tower. The £219 price includes breakfast and Eurostar train travel. Alternative hotels are available. Eurotours (0870 380 7380). Under £400 Invitation to Tuscany (0121 429 5016) has three apartments in a Tuscan farmhouse, available throughout March. The smallest sleeps two for £329 per week and the others four for £397. Prices exclude travel. A one-week 'learn to sail' flotilla cruise along Croatia's Dalmatian coast during Easter week costs £395 with Activity Holidays (01932 867418). Departing 29 March, the package also includes flights, transfers and tuition. Two weeks costs £525. Under £600 For 'single' men aged 45 to 69 Solo's Holidays (08700 720 700) are offering a seven night skiing break especially for beginners and intermediate skiers staying in single rooms at the Kompas Hotel in the Slovenian resort of Kranjska Gora. The accommodation is half board and, including scheduled flights from Heathrow to Ljubljana and transfers, the price is £569. You will need to make a quick decision since this trip leaves on 2 March. You can enjoy three nights at the five-star Grand Hotel Wiesler in Graz, Austria. Depart on Good Friday from Heathrow to Vienna followed by first-class onward train travel. A candlelit dinner and walking tour are also included for £599. Austria Travel (01708 222000). Under £700 The Imaginative Traveller (020 8742 8612) still have a couple of places on their Moroccan Highlights tour visiting the four Imperial Cities of Rabat, Fes, Meknes and Marrakech departing 15 March. The cost of this fully escorted tour, including train and minibus transport and seven nights mid-range hotel accommodation with breakfast is £649, a £40 reduction on the brochure price. Scheduled Royal Air Maroc flights from Heathrow. Perched 200m above the sea, with views down to Mazzaro Beach, Taormina in Sicily makes for a perfect retreat. The funicular takes you down to the beaches and Taormina Mare. Crystal Premier Italy (0870 888 0024) are offering a seven night break at the four star Hotel Villa Diodoro for £640 if departing by 14 March. This price includes breakfasts, Gatwick scheduled flights with Alitalia to Catania and transfers. Seven nights at the five-star Crowne Plaza Hotel in Funchal, Madeira, comes with £200 off and a free Easter egg for under-12s. Departing 29 March, the break costs £699 (£529 for two- to 12-year-olds) and includes flights from Gatwick and transfers. Cadogan Holidays (02380 828313). Under £1,000 Spain at Heart (01373 814222) has a traditional farmhouse, sleeping nine, in La Teja, Andalucia, available for a week from 23 March for £980. Flights from Gatwick to Malaga cost £195. Car hire is essential. · Prices are per person and all travel is return.
